dt: {bc}a communication in writing, in speech, or by signals

dt.t: Please take this {wi}message{/wi} for me to my friend.
the girl will go on a {wi}message{/wi} to the shop
the {wi}message{/wi} is that it is time to change

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Medieval Latin {it}missaticum{/it}, from Latin {it}missus{/it}, past participle of {it}mittere{/it}
shortdef: a communication in writing, in speech, or by signals

dt: {bc}to send as a message or by {a_link|messenger}

shortdef: to send as a message or by messenger

dt: {bc}a board or sign on which messages or notices are displayed
{bc}a public electronic forum that allows users to post or read messages or to post or download files and that is accessed by computer over a network (such as the Internet)

dt.t: Even as bullpen problems loom …, they haven't spawned the typical degree of urgency and panic on Internet {wi}message boards{/wi} and sports radio shows.

shortdef: a board or sign on which messages or notices are displayed
a public electronic forum that allows users to post or read messages or to post or download files and that is accessed by computer over a network (such as the Internet)

dt: {bc}a technology for sending short {d_link|text messages|text message} between mobile phones {bc}{sx|sms||}

dt.t: {wi}Short message service{/wi} (SMS or text messaging) is doing especially well and is expected to be a bigger business than consumer messaging by 2006, Patterson says.

shortdef: a technology for sending short text messages between mobile phones : sms

dt: {bc}a short message sent electronically usually from one cell phone to another

shortdef: a short message sent electronically usually from one cell phone to another

dt: {bc}a message indicating that an error has occurred

shortdef: a message indicating that an error has occurred

dt: {bc}to understand something that is not being said directly

dt.t: When they didn't return my phone calls, I finally {it}got the message{/it}.
He gave her an angry look, hoping she'd {it}get the message{/it}.

shortdef: to understand something that is not being said directly

dt: {bc}saying things that do not agree with the official position of a political group or party

dt.t: A few Cabinet members seem {it}off message{/it} on government policy.

shortdef: saying things that do not agree with the official position of a political group or party

dt: {bc}saying things that agree with the official position of a political group or party

dt.t: The President wants everyone to be/get back {it}on message{/it} when giving interviews.

shortdef: saying things that agree with the official position of a political group or party

dt: {bc}a means or system for transmitting electronic messages instantly

shortdef: a means or system for transmitting electronic messages instantly
